gamble.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to risk money or possessions on the result of something such as a card game or a race, when you do not know for certain what the result will be
gamble.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: Their religion forbids them to drink or gamble.
Jack loves gambling on the horses.
gamble.translation[0].definitions[1].def: to do something that involves a lot of risk, and that will not succeed unless things happen the way you would like them to
gamble.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: They’re gambling on Johnson being fit for Saturday’s game.
Potter gambled everything on his new play being a hit.
She was gambling that he wouldn’t read it too carefully.
We can’t relax our safety standards – we’d be gambling with people’s lives.
gamble.translation[0].note_box[0].sectio: gamble
to try to win money, for example by playing cards or guessing which horse will win a race
Eddie loved to gamble, and would spend most evenings at the roulette table.
A growing number of people are gambling online.
bet/have a bet
to try to win money by guessing who will win a race or game
He liked to smoke, drink, and bet on horses.
Jerry bet $1000 on the game.
We had a bet on the Irish team to win.
put £10/$20 etc on something
to gamble £10, $20 etc on the horse or team that you think will win a race or competition
I put $100 on the Cowboys to win.
have a flutter
to gamble a small amount of money, especially on the result of a horse race – used especially when someone does not gamble very often
I’m not a heavy gambler, but I like to have a flutter from time to time.
I had a little flutter on the Grand National and won £5.
play for money
to gamble money on the result of a game which you are playing
‘Are we playing for money here, gentlemen?’ he said as he approached the pool table.
You’re allowed to play cards in the bar, but not for money.
to gamble money on a particular horse, team etc that you think will win a race or competition
When I back a horse, it always seems to finish second.
gamble.translation[1].definitions[0].def: an action or plan that involves a risk but that you hope will succeed
gamble.translation[1].definitions[0].exa: It was a big gamble for her to leave the band and go solo.
Ellen had to admit the gamble had paid off (=succeeded).
In a depressed market, we cannot afford to take a gamble on a new product.
The gamble on the harvest had paid off  (=succeeded).
gamble.translation[1].note_box[0].sectio: The publishers took a gamble on an unknown author, and the books have sold well.
She gave up a career in law to become an actor, but the gamble has paid off.
It's a big gamble for any presenter to leave such a successful show.
Giving him the job seemed like a huge gamble at the time.
He made a calculated gamble that an early election would return his party to power.
The parents took a desperate gamble by throwing their baby out of the burning building.
His determination to go ahead with the plan, despite the unrest, was a huge political gamble.
be a bit of a gamble
It was a bit of a gamble putting him on the field, but he played well.
A few years ago, launching a weekly magazine for men would have been something of a gamble.
gamble.translation[2].definitions[0].def: to risk money on the stockmarket or a new business activity in the hope of making a profit
gamble.translation[2].definitions[0].exa: The company is gambling on a new clothing line expanding its business.
The Hollywood studio gambled £20 million on making the most expensive black-and-white film ever.
The two men gambled with £6,000 of their savings to establish a research company.
gamble.translation[2].definitions[1].def: to risk money on the result of something uncertain such as a card game or race
gamble.translation[2].definitions[1].exa: While on Madeira, he gambled at the island’s casino.
gamble.translation[3].definitions[0].def: an action or plan that involves a risk but that you hope will succeed
gamble.translation[3].definitions[0].exa: All stock exchange investment is a gamble.
The board decided to embark on aggressive overseas expansion, the biggest gamble it had ever taken.
